trans-unit.source: Create a virtual machine running Windows in the Azure preview portal | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Create a virtual machine running Windows in the Azure preview portal | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create an Azure virtual machine running Windows, using the Azure Marketplace in the Azure preview portal
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create an Azure virtual machine running Windows, using the Azure Marketplace in the Azure preview portal

trans-unit.source: Create a virtual machine running Windows in the Azure preview portal
trans-unit.target: Create a virtual machine running Windows in the Azure preview portal

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how easy it is to create an Azure virtual machine in just a few minutes in the preview portal.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how easy it is to create an Azure virtual machine in just a few minutes in the preview portal.

trans-unit.source: We'll use a Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter image as an example to create the virtual machine, but that's just one of the many images Azure offers.
trans-unit.target: We'll use a Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter image as an example to create the virtual machine, but that's just one of the many images Azure offers.

trans-unit.source: Your image choices depend on your subscription.
trans-unit.target: Your image choices depend on your subscription.

trans-unit.source: For example, desktop images may be available to MSDN subscribers.
trans-unit.target: For example, desktop images may be available to MSDN subscribers.

trans-unit.source: You can also create virtual machines using your own images, with Resource Manager templates, or with automation tools.
trans-unit.target: You can also create virtual machines using your own images, with Resource Manager templates, or with automation tools.

trans-unit.source: To learn about the different methods, see <link><linkText>Different Ways to Create a Windows Virtual Machine</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To learn about the different methods, see <link><linkText>Different Ways to Create a Windows Virtual Machine</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial uses the Resource Manager deployment model to create the virtual machine. This is recommended instead of the classic deployment model, which is based on Service Management APIs. For details about Resource Manager, see <link><linkText>Azure Resource Manager Overview</linkText><title></title></link>. To learn about the benefits of using Resource Manager for virtual machines, see <link><linkText>Azure Compute, Network & Storage Providers under Azure Resource Manager</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial uses the Resource Manager deployment model to create the virtual machine. This is recommended instead of the classic deployment model, which is based on Service Management APIs. For details about Resource Manager, see <link><linkText>Azure Resource Manager Overview</linkText><title></title></link>. To learn about the benefits of using Resource Manager for virtual machines, see <link><linkText>Azure Compute, Network & Storage Providers under Azure Resource Manager</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Video walkthrough
trans-unit.target: Video walkthrough

trans-unit.source: Here's a walkthrough of this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: Here's a walkthrough of this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Select the image
trans-unit.target: Select the image

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <link><linkText>preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <link><linkText>preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: On the Hub menu, click New > Compute > Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter.
trans-unit.target: On the Hub menu, click New > Compute > Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Marketplace</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Marketplace</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To find additional images, click Marketplace and then search or filter for available items.
trans-unit.target: To find additional images, click Marketplace and then search or filter for available items.

trans-unit.source: On the Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter page, under Select a deployment model, select Resource Manager.
trans-unit.target: On the Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter page, under Select a deployment model, select Resource Manager.

trans-unit.source: Click Create.
trans-unit.target: Click Create.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Search in the Marketplace</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Search in the Marketplace</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Create the virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Create the virtual machine

trans-unit.source: After you select the image, you can use Azure's default settings for most of the configuration and quickly create the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: After you select the image, you can use Azure's default settings for most of the configuration and quickly create the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: On the Create virtual machine blade, click Basics.
trans-unit.target: On the Create virtual machine blade, click Basics.

trans-unit.source: Enter a Name you want for the virtual machine, the administrative User name, and a strong Password.
trans-unit.target: Enter a Name you want for the virtual machine, the administrative User name, and a strong Password.

trans-unit.source: If you have more than one subscription, specify the one for the new virtual machine, as well as a new or existing Resource group and an Azure datacenter Location.
trans-unit.target: If you have more than one subscription, specify the one for the new virtual machine, as well as a new or existing Resource group and an Azure datacenter Location.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure VM basics</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure VM basics</linkText>

trans-unit.source: User name refers to the administrative account that you'll use to manage the server.
trans-unit.target: User name refers to the administrative account that you'll use to manage the server.

trans-unit.source: Create a password that's hard for others to guess but that you can remember.
trans-unit.target: Create a password that's hard for others to guess but that you can remember.

trans-unit.source: You'll need the user name and password to log on to the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: You'll need the user name and password to log on to the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Click Size and select an appropriate virtual machine size for your needs.
trans-unit.target: Click Size and select an appropriate virtual machine size for your needs.

trans-unit.source: Each size specifies the number of compute cores, memory, and other features, such as support for Premium Storage, which will affect the price.
trans-unit.target: Each size specifies the number of compute cores, memory, and other features, such as support for Premium Storage, which will affect the price.

trans-unit.source: Azure recommends certain sizes automatically depending on the image you choose.
trans-unit.target: Azure recommends certain sizes automatically depending on the image you choose.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure VM size</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure VM size</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Premium storage is available for DS-series virtual machines in certain regions.
trans-unit.target: Premium storage is available for DS-series virtual machines in certain regions.

trans-unit.source: Premium storage is the best storage option for data intensive workloads such as a database.
trans-unit.target: Premium storage is the best storage option for data intensive workloads such as a database.

trans-unit.source: For details, see <link><linkText>Premium Storage: High-Performance Storage for Azure Virtual Machine Workloads</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For details, see <link><linkText>Premium Storage: High-Performance Storage for Azure Virtual Machine Workloads</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Click Settings to see storage and networking settings for the new virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Click Settings to see storage and networking settings for the new virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: For a first virtual machine you can generally accept the default settings.
trans-unit.target: For a first virtual machine you can generally accept the default settings.

trans-unit.source: If you selected a virtual machine size that supports it, you can try out Premium Storage by selecting Premium (SSD) under Disk type.
trans-unit.target: If you selected a virtual machine size that supports it, you can try out Premium Storage by selecting Premium (SSD) under Disk type.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure VM settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure VM settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Summary to review your configuration choices.
trans-unit.target: Click Summary to review your configuration choices.

trans-unit.source: When you're done reviewing or updating the settings, click Create.
trans-unit.target: When you're done reviewing or updating the settings, click Create.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure VM settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure VM settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: While Azure creates the virtual machine, you can track the progress in Notifications, in the Hub menu.
trans-unit.target: While Azure creates the virtual machine, you can track the progress in Notifications, in the Hub menu.

trans-unit.source: After Azure creates the virtual machine, you'll see it on your Startboard unless you cleared Pin to Startboard in the Create virtual machine blade.
trans-unit.target: After Azure creates the virtual machine, you'll see it on your Startboard unless you cleared Pin to Startboard in the Create virtual machine blade.

trans-unit.source: Log on to the virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Log on to the virtual machine

trans-unit.source: After you create the virtual machine, you'll want to log on to it so you can manage its settings and the applications that you'll run on it.
trans-unit.target: After you create the virtual machine, you'll want to log on to it so you can manage its settings and the applications that you'll run on it.

trans-unit.source: For requirements and troubleshooting tips, see <link><linkText>Connect to an Azure virtual machine with RDP or SSH</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For requirements and troubleshooting tips, see <link><linkText>Connect to an Azure virtual machine with RDP or SSH</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't already done so, sign in to the <link><linkText>preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't already done so, sign in to the <link><linkText>preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Click your virtual machine on the Startboard.
trans-unit.target: Click your virtual machine on the Startboard.

trans-unit.source: If you need to find it, click Browse All > Recent or Browse All > Virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: If you need to find it, click Browse All > Recent or Browse All > Virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: Then, select your virtual machine from the list.
trans-unit.target: Then, select your virtual machine from the list.

trans-unit.source: On the virtual machine blade, click Connect.
trans-unit.target: On the virtual machine blade, click Connect.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Log on to the virtual machine</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Log on to the virtual machine</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Open to use the Remote Desktop Protocol file that's automatically created for the Windows Server virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Click Open to use the Remote Desktop Protocol file that's automatically created for the Windows Server virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Click Connect.
trans-unit.target: Click Connect.

trans-unit.source: Type the user name and password you set when you created the virtual machine, and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: Type the user name and password you set when you created the virtual machine, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: Click Yes to verify the identity of the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Click Yes to verify the identity of the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: You can now work with the virtual machine just as you would with any other server.
trans-unit.target: You can now work with the virtual machine just as you would with any other server.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Use Azure PowerShell and the Azure CLI to <link><linkText>find and select virtual machine images</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Use Azure PowerShell and the Azure CLI to <link><linkText>find and select virtual machine images</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Automate virtual machine and workload deployment and management using <link><linkText>Azure Resource Manager</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Azure Resource Manager templates</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Automate virtual machine and workload deployment and management using <link><linkText>Azure Resource Manager</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Azure Resource Manager templates</linkText><title></title></link>.
